column4: does anybody know what happened to the displayconfig-gtk utility in hardy?
i have a graphics card that supports resolutions up to 4096x? according to xrandr
but i can't get any resolutions to get set permanently
and there's no Xorg.conf file in karmic??? like wtf
thers  none needed in many cases
and thats changes from the X updates.. not really a ubuntu specific feature
yea but what about the users that do need it?!?!?!? Are they expected to type in xrandr commands every time they log in to GDM
the nvidia settings tool made a xorg.conf for me
I have an Intel Atom chipset and I have no xorg.conf
on my netbook the display settings tool sets the default res for my users somewhere in their home dir.. so its not an iss to me
my netbook AAO, has no xorg.conf - and i can set/change my res with the tools and it rembers.
If I could simply set the correct resolution in Prefs -> Display then i would be happy
iw as able to enable the 2nd monitor and have it running at a higher res and it rembers
but it only has resolutions for 800x600
that tool rembers them for me. I DO recall i might of had to hit the fn-monitor button to enable the external monitor. then  used that tool.
on my netbook the netbook has its res. then the external monitor has its own res.
